item.title: Local Streamlit app for browsing Kindle highlights
item.description:
I wanted to view the highlights and notes from the books I have read on my Kindle to be able to make some posts for this blog, but Amazon don’t make it easy for some reason.

The My Clippings.txt file, where a reader’s notes, highlights and bookmarks are stored, is hard to read and annoying. Apparently an industry has come up to help users make sense of their own notes and clippings-for a fee ofcourse.

item.title: Who am I?
item.description:
Hello, I am called Anuj Kumar and thank you for showing an interest in learning about me.

I have been a financial derivatives trader, a data scientist, a chef, a spiritual guide, a painter, a writer - and I continue to be all of them. I enjoy testing the limits of what I am capable of doing professionally. There are infinite possibilities to explore.

At the core of my being is the desire to understand, manipulate, model and communicate the story behind words and numbers which govern the world and ideas around us. I am equally adept and comfortable with both of them. I am thrilled about the opportunities in this brave new AI world to usher in a preternatural era of prosperity and growth for all.

item.title: Music which does not distract
item.description: Some background sound is always preferable to avoid our minds from chattering away. Well that has been my experience. I do not understand why it happens. Spiritual teachers such as the Buddha have suggested that if we are able to keep our minds from thinking about anything for even a single minute, we are already enlightened. It seems such an easy thing to say but incredibly hard to put into action.

item.title: Tron:Ares review
item.description:
This movie is a feast for the senses.

The red color is star of the show, which is to be expected from the title’s allusion to the Greek god of warfare and bloodshed. The cinematography is brilliant; CGI hits the sweet spot and my god the soundtrack by Nine Inch Nails! Some have even gone as far as to suggest that the movie is essentially a video companion to their music.
